intro: Hieracium integrifolium subsp. elegantissimum, commonly known as the elegant hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The leaves are typically hairy and have a serrated or lobed edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Native to Europe, this subspecies is often found in meadows and grasslands. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is considered a species of conservation interest in some regions.
